column4: Hi all, my 11.10 install isn't booting up anymore. The last time we were using it, it looked like the flash plugin had got corrupted or something. Then there was an error about some packages getting corrupted or something. Now the system won't boot. Blank screen. I'm able to get into the basic recovery shell and fsck checks out fine. I'm not able to boot into runlevel 3. How do I go about getting into a shell that supports basic networking? Thanks.
Isn't there a menu entry that starts with network?
Nope.
I crashed mine some days ago and I could choose beteen normal boot, recorvery and recovery with network
O.o
schmidtm, 11.10?
Anyway what tells you ifconfig?
Hold on, booting into recovery now.
Nothing.
I tried "networking start" but that didn't work.
Wait, "service networking start" works, and now ifconfig lists the localhost
err, the loopback interface
now how do I load eth0 :P
Is it configured with networj manager?
Yeah
if it doesn't show up you need to load te apropriate kernel modeule
I guess sudo ifconfig eth0 up, will not work
The card is a marvell 88E8036 fast ethernet controller
Know which module to load for that?
start udev
Still only the loopback.
isn't there some udev-trigger to start as well.
